verses.text: Verily thus saith the Lord unto you, my servant Lyman: Your sins are forgiven you, because you have obeyed my voice in coming up hither this morning to receive counsel of him whom I have appointed.

similars.text: Hearken now unto my voice, I will give thee counsel, and God shall be with thee: Be thou for the people to God-ward, that thou mayest bring the causes unto God:
And now the Lord shew kindness and truth unto you: and I also will requite you this kindness, because ye have done this thing.

And now my beloved brethren, I have said these things unto you that I might awaken you to a sense of your duty to God, that ye may walk blameless before him, that ye may walk after the holy order of God, after which ye have been received.
Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.
Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.
For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God.
Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.

Counsel with the Lord in all thy doings, and he will direct thee for good; yea, when thou liest down at night lie down unto the Lord, that he may watch over you in your sleep; and when thou risest in the morning let thy heart be full of thanks unto God; and if ye do these things, ye shall be lifted up at the last day.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.
Blessed be the Lord, because he hath heard the voice of my supplications.

verses.text: Therefore, let your soul be at rest concerning your spiritual standing, and resist no more my voice.

similars.text: Awake, my soul! No longer droop in sin. Rejoice, O my heart, and give place no more for the enemy of my soul.
It shall be a sabbath of rest unto you, and ye shall afflict your souls, by a statute for ever.
For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O Lord.
Preserve my soul; for I am holy: O thou my God, save thy servant that trusteth in thee.

And now, in your epistle you have censured me, but it mattereth not; I am not angry, but do rejoice in the greatness of your heart. I, Pahoran, do not seek for power, save only to retain my judgment-seat that I may preserve the rights and the liberty of my people. My soul standeth fast in that liberty in the which God hath made us free.
Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression.
O keep my soul, and deliver me: let me not be ashamed; for I put my trust in thee.
There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.
Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I be not ashamed.
Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O Lord: let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.

verses.text: And arise up and be more careful henceforth in observing your vows, which you have made and do make, and you shall be blessed with exceeding great blessings.

similars.text: Ye therefore, beloved, seeing ye know these things before, beware lest ye also, being led away with the error of the wicked, fall from your own steadfastness.

But this much I can tell you, that if ye do not watch yourselves, and your thoughts, and your words, and your deeds, and observe the commandments of God, and continue in the faith of what ye have heard concerning the coming of our Lord, even unto the end of your lives, ye must perish. And now, O man, remember, and perish not.
My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.
A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.

Yea, and I also exhort you, my brethren, that ye be watchful unto prayer continually, that ye may not be led away by the temptations of the devil, that he may not overpower you, that ye may not become his subjects at the last day; for behold, he rewardeth you no good thing.
And I will make my covenant between me and thee, and will multiply thee exceedingly.
Be surety for thy servant for good: let not the proud oppress me.
Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render praises unto thee.

And when ye shall see these sayings coming forth among you, then ye need not any longer spurn at the doings of the Lord, for the sword of his justice is in his right hand; and behold, at that day, if ye shall spurn at his doings he will cause that it shall soon overtake you.
Be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain, that are ready to die: for I have not found thy works perfect before God.

verses.text: Wait patiently until the solemn assembly shall be called of my servants, then you shall be remembered with the first of mine elders, and receive right by ordination with the rest of mine elders whom I have chosen.

similars.text: When I shall receive the congregation I will judge uprightly.
Let integrity and uprightness preserve me; for I wait on thee.
Yea, the work shall commence among all the dispersed of my people, with the Father to prepare the way whereby they may come unto me, that they may call on the Father in my name.
Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.
Brethren, be followers together of me, and mark them which walk so as ye have us for an ensample.
And who, as I, shall call, and shall declare it, and set it in order for me, since I appointed the ancient people? and the things that are coming, and shall come, let them shew unto them.
I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.
Sanctify ye a fast, call a solemn assembly, gather the elders and all the inhabitants of the land into the house of the Lord your God, and cry unto the Lord,
And the king's servants said unto the king, Behold, thy servants are ready to do whatsoever my lord the king shall appoint.
For behold, in my name are they called; and if they know me they shall come forth, and shall have a place eternally at my right hand.

verses.text: Behold, this is the promise of the Father unto you if you continue faithful.

similars.text: For he will fulfil all his promises which he shall make unto you, for he has fulfilled his promises which he has made unto our fathers.
For the promise is unto you, and to your children, and to all that are afar off, even as many as the Lord our God shall call.
For ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.
Faithful is he that calleth you, who also will do it.
And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers,
Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)
And, behold, I send the promise of my Father upon you: but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem, until ye be endued with power from on high.
Therefore blessed are ye if ye shall keep my commandments, which the Father hath commanded me that I should give unto you.
(The Lord God of your fathers make you a thousand times so many more as ye are, and bless you, as he hath promised you!)
And I heard a voice from the Father, saying: Yea, the words of my Beloved are true and faithful. He that endureth to the end, the same shall be saved.

verses.text: And it shall be fulfilled upon you in that day that you shall have right to preach my gospel wheresoever I shall send you, from henceforth from that time.

similars.text: And it shall come to pass that the time cometh, when the fulness of my gospel shall be preached unto them;
Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;
And he shall send Jesus Christ, which before was preached unto you:
And whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name, which is right, believing that ye shall receive, behold it shall be given unto you.
So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.
For thus saith the scripture: Choose ye this day, whom ye will serve.
Yea, it shall come in a day when there shall be churches built up that shall say: Come unto me, and for your money you shall be forgiven of your sins.
And it shall come to pass, when ye be come to the land which the Lord will give you, according as he hath promised, that ye shall keep this service.
Verily I say unto you, Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world, there shall also this, that this woman hath done, be told for a memorial of her.
Therefore give heed to my words; write the things which I have told you; and according to the time and the will of the Father they shall go forth unto the Gentiles.

verses.text: Therefore, strengthen your brethren in all your conversation, in all your prayers, in all your exhortations, and in all your doings.

similars.text: And now, my brethren, I would speak unto you more; but on the morrow I will declare unto you the remainder of my words. Amen.
But as he which hath called you is holy, so be ye holy in all manner of conversation;
I exhort therefore, that, first of all, supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks, be made for all men;
Brethren, let every man, wherein he is called, therein abide with God.
I will raise them up a Prophet from among their brethren, like unto thee, and will put my words in his mouth; and he shall speak unto them all that I shall command him.
How is it then, brethren? when ye come together, every one of you hath a psalm, hath a doctrine, hath a tongue, hath a revelation, hath an interpretation. Let all things be done unto edifying.
For my brethren and companions' sakes, I will now say, Peace be within thee.

And now my beloved brethren, I have spoken these words unto you according to the Spirit which testifieth in me; and my soul doth exceedingly rejoice, because of the exceeding diligence and heed which ye have given unto my word.
We are bound to thank God always for you, brethren, as it is meet, because that your faith groweth exceedingly, and the charity of every one of you all toward each other aboundeth;
And indeed ye do it toward all the brethren which are in all Macedonia: but we beseech you, brethren, that ye increase more and more;

verses.text: And behold, and lo, I am with you to bless you and deliver you forever. Amen.

similars.text: As for me, behold, I am in your hand: do with me as seemeth good and meet unto you.
All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
Behold, here is the man, we deliver him into thy hands; thou mayest do with him as seemeth thee good.
Blessed be the Lord for evermore. Amen, and Amen.
My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
